security_audit.summary: This skill performs legitimate code testing and validation using standard development tools. It creates isolated sandboxes for testing, executes code with coverage reporting, and generates audit reports. While it has filesystem and external command capabilities, these are necessary for its testing functionality and are used appropriately.

low_findings.title: Temporary directory creation in /tmp
low_findings.description: The skill creates temporary directories in /tmp for sandbox environments. While this is standard practice for testing, it could potentially be exploited if proper permissions aren't set.

low_findings.title: Command execution through npm/npx
low_findings.description: The skill executes npm and npx commands to install dependencies and run tests. This is necessary functionality but could be risky if package.json is compromised.

content.user_title: Validate Code Execution with Comprehensive Testing
content.value_statement: Ensure your code actually works beyond static analysis. This skill creates isolated test environments, executes comprehensive tests, debugs failures systematically, and validates fixes without regressions.
actual_capabilities: Creates isolated sandbox environments for safe code execution
Executes comprehensive test suites with realistic inputs
Systematically debugs and categorizes failures by root cause
Validates fixes and checks for regressions automatically
Generates detailed audit reports with metrics and recommendations
Integrates with CI/CD pipelines for automated validation
limitations: Testing framework must be installed in target project
Cannot validate code that requires external services or databases
Sandbox isolation may not capture all production environment issues

use_cases.title: Validate AI-Generated Code
use_cases.description: Ensure code generated by AI assistants actually executes correctly and meets requirements before merging to main branch.

use_cases.title: Pre-Deployment Validation
use_cases.description: Run comprehensive functionality audits as part of CI/CD pipeline to catch issues before production deployment.

use_cases.title: PR Quality Assurance
use_cases.description: Systematically validate pull request changes through automated testing and debugging to ensure code quality standards.

best_practices: Run functionality audits after any significant code changes or AI generation
Use the sandbox environment to test potentially risky code safely
Review the detailed audit report for insights on code quality and coverage
Integrate functionality audits into CI/CD pipelines for automated validation
anti_patterns: Don't skip functionality validation for seemingly simple changes
Avoid running audits directly on production code without sandbox isolation
Don't ignore the debugging phase - systematic root cause analysis is crucial
Never deploy code that hasn't passed the production readiness validation

faq.question: Which programming languages does this skill support?
faq.answer: Currently supports Node.js/JavaScript/TypeScript and Python projects. The skill auto-detects project type and configures appropriate testing frameworks.

faq.question: What testing frameworks are used?
faq.answer: For Node.js: Jest with coverage reporting. For Python: pytest with coverage. The skill automatically installs and configures the optimal framework for your project.

faq.question: Can this integrate with my existing CI/CD pipeline?
faq.answer: Yes, the skill generates exit codes and JSON reports that integrate seamlessly with GitHub Actions, GitLab CI, Jenkins, and other CI/CD systems.

faq.question: Is my code safe during the audit process?
faq.answer: Yes, all testing occurs in isolated sandbox environments. Your original code remains untouched, and the skill creates backups before any modifications.

faq.question: What if the audit finds too many issues?
faq.answer: The skill categorizes issues by priority and provides a systematic fix strategy. You can address critical issues first and re-run the audit iteratively.

faq.question: How does this compare to standard linting tools?
faq.answer: Unlike linting tools that check code style, this skill validates actual execution and functionality. It complements linting by ensuring code works, not just looks correct.
